intro: Eleocharis valida, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant features dense, grass-like foliage with spike-like inflorescences that contain small, wind-pollinated flowers. Its rhizomes help it spread and establish colonies in moist soils. Eleocharis valida plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
